title: Secure Coding
description: Secure Coding Standards are guidelines and expectations that help to ensure that the application under devlopment is protected against common or severe flaws that expose the application to attack.
key-ideas: Secure Coding Standards are related to the principle of Secure By Design.
Secure Coding Standards cannot protect an application that has a flaw in its design.
Secure Coding Standards are closely related to the Software Development Lifecycle.
ritical and sensitive functions should be handled server side
Use standard routines and libraries where possible
